moves.1. d4: My second rated benoni  on gameknot
moves.4. d5 exd5: That's not the main line and probably not the best for black. I should have plaid g6
moves.5. cxd5 d6 6. e4: Now we go back to classical benoni
moves.8. Bb5+ Nfd7: Mistake (I wanted to menace the knight)
moves.10... Qe7: Dangerous but the rooks are far away. it will take at least 4 moves for white to  bring one on the e file
moves.11. Qc2 Nf6:
Now black's plan is to deal with the e pawn as soon as possible.
But the knight goes back to the place it was before the 8th move...
moves.13. O-O Re8: Now the king is safe, let's attack the central white pawns
moves.14... Bg4: I see no way to directly attack the e pawn but a sequence is possible attacking directly the king. I think I can at least obtain a draw (which would not be so bad with black against a player rated 100 points more) and may be a win, although I do not see the winning sequence.
moves.15. Rb1: It seems that white didn't foresee the sequence black is about to drive
moves.15... Bxf3: To launch his attack, black needs to get rid of the knight (the DSB shall come on d4)
moves.16... Ng4: Freeing the DSB and menacing h2
moves.17... Bd4+ 18. Kh1: White had little choice (if  18. Kf1 Nh2+ and the rook on f3 is lost.)
moves.19... Nf2+: Black can only obtain the draw,
